quote_a: It's actually nice to know that the AI is listening and is able to provide follow-up questions based on my previous responses. That was really refreshing. We don't always get that from a human interviewer, so that was nice.
quote_b: I think a human would probably have follow-up questions in mind, but with this AI interviewer, it feels a little bit more spontaneous.
explanation: In the first quote the participant says AI is better than humans at providing follow-up questions; in the second, they say humans are more deliberate with follow-up while the AI feels spontaneous — two opposing framings of who is stronger at planned follow-up.

quote_a: It seems they didn't have enough information, which was okay with me. So, yeah, I wasn't able to get the response I was looking for from the AI assistants because they just didn't have enough information on me.
explanation: The participant dismisses a clear failure to get useful AI responses with "which was okay with me", yet immediately after spends considerable time describing an aspirational AI deeply integrated into their personal data — suggesting the limitation was not genuinely okay.
